articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Nam O
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kim Nam O
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Thursday sent a wreath to the bier of Kim Nam O, winner of Order of Kim Il Sung and former head of the Pochonbo Electronic Band, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: MOU on Scientific and Technological Cooperation Signed between DPRK and Mongolia
articles.content:
MOU on Scientific and Technological Cooperation Signed between DPRK and Mongolia
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A MOU on scientific and technological cooperation between the State Science and Technology Commission of the DPRK and the Ministry of Education and Science of Mongolia was inked here  on Thursday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Jon Gyong, vice-chairperson of the State Science and Technology Commission, and its other officials and from the Mongolian side Manibadrakh Ganbold, Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.

articles.title: S. Korean Resident Handed over to S. Korean Red Cross
articles.content:
S. Korean Resident Handed over to S. Korean Red Cross
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society handed over a south Korean resident, who illegally entered into the territory of the north side, to the south Korean Red Cross via Panmunjom Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), met and had a talk with Alexandr Torshyn, first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Present there were An Tong Chun, vice-chairman of the SPA, Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy official.
					
					 Alexandr Torshyn expressed thanks for the cordial hospitality accorded to him by the Korean people, adding that he would make positive efforts to develop the traditional Russia-DPRK friendly relations.

articles.title: Greetings to Foreign Minister of People's Power of Venezuela
articles.content:
Greetings to Foreign Minister of People's Power of Venezuela
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Rafael Ramirez Carreno upon his appointment as vice prime minister and foreign minister of the People's Power of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela.
					 The message expressed expectation and belief that the bilateral relations would grow stronger on a higher stage this year, the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries, and wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: DPRK FM Leaves for Iran
articles.content:
DPRK FM Leaves for Iran
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, and his party left here Thursday to take part in the 53rd meeting of Asian-African Legal Consultative Organization to be held in Iran and pay an official goodwill visit to Iran. 
					 They were seen off at the airport by Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung,   Alireza Ghanimatpour, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Iranian embassy here, and Alexandr Timonin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from Alexandr Torshyn, first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by Alexandr Torshyn on Thursday.

articles.title: KCNA Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
articles.content:
KCNA Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Central News Agency led by Director General Kim Chang Gwang left here Thursday to visit Mongolia.
					 It was seen off at the airport by Chon Il, vice director general of the KCNA, and staff members of the Mongolian embassy here.

articles.title: First Vice-Chairman of Federation Council of Russia Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
First Vice-Chairman of Federation Council of Russia Visits Mangyongdae
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Torshyn, first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, and his party visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They went round historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae where the President was born and spent his childhood, being briefed on the undying stories about the old home.
					
					 They toured revolutionary relics on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 The first vice-chairman said:
					
					 I was deeply impressed to visit the old home in Mangyongdae.
					
					 We have come to know well that the President's family was very simple and poor one.
					
					 He embarked on the road of the revolution in his early years and achieved the independence of the country.
					
					 Visiting the old home, I was surprised by the diligence and devotion of the President's family members in Mangyongdae.
					
					 The rising generation is earnestly learning from the great revolutionary lives of the President and his family members.
					
					 I was deeply impressed to see the Korean people preserve and manage well the old home in Mangyongdae and glorify the revolutionary history of the leader.
					
					 The guests also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Okryu Children's Hospital, the Mirim Riding Club, the Songdowon International Children's Camp and other places in Pyongyang and local areas. They went round the Liberation Tower and the Jongbaek Church.

articles.title: British Delegation of Businessmen Tours Various Places
articles.content:
British Delegation of Businessmen Tours Various Places
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The British delegation of businessmen led by Evgeny Lebedev visited the Tower of the Juche Idea.
					 The guests went round the tower and group of sculptures, went up to the observation deck of the tower and commanded a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang.
					
					 The delegation also visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the Pyongyang Metro, etc.

articles.title: Delegation of Kyodo News Leaves
articles.content:
Delegation of Kyodo News Leaves
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Kyodo News headed by President Masaki Fukuyama left here for home on Thursday.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Leaves
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The Yamanashi Prefectural delegation for Japan-DPRK friendship led by Yasunobu Kanemaru, president of the Television Yamanashi Co., Ltd. left here for home Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex.
					 Going round the heat production shop, the turbine shop and various other places of the complex, the premier greatly encouraged its workers and learned in detail about the production there and management of equipment.
					
					 A consultative meeting of officials concerned was held on the spot. It discussed issues of improving the management of equipment and technical control to operate generators in full capacity, giving priority to the supply of materials needed for overhauling generating equipment and increasing the generating efficiency.
					
					 The premier called upon all officials and workers of the complex to focus all their efforts on boosting the electricity production, bearing in mind that increasing the production of electricity at present is part of the drive to implement the party's idea and defend the party's policies.
					
					 Earlier, the premier went round the February 8 Jikdong Youth Coal Mine.
					
					 Referring to the important role to be played by the coal mine in settling the acute shortage of electricity, he discussed the ways of increasing the coal production.
					
					 Meanwhile, he learned about the work at the Central Mining Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences and underlined the need for its scientists and technicians to reliably guarantee the building of an economic power with scientific and technological achievements.

articles.title: Mosaics Depicting Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Different Units of DPRK
articles.content:
Mosaics Depicting Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Erected in Different Units of DPRK
Kanggye, September 11 (KCNA) -- Mosaics depicting the portraits of smiling peerless great men of Mt. Paektu "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung Will Always Be with Us" and "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Will Always Be with Us" were erected in Chosan and Wiwon counties, the Jonchon Coal Mine and the Usi Mine in Jagang Province.
					 President Kim Il Sung visited Chosan County several times, clearly indicating the orientation and ways for improving the standard of people's living in the mountainous area by developing the rural economy and local industry. Leader Kim Jong Il, accompanying the President providing field guidance for the happiness of the people, led Chosan County to creditably perform its function and role as a regional center for socialist rural construction.
					
					 Wiwon County is associated with the undying feats of the President and Kim Jong Il who visited the county, chose the sites of a power station and the county seat and led it to improve the people's living standard by planting many industrial crops suited to the topographical features.
					
					 The President visited the Jonchon Coal Mine, indicating the way to be followed by it and Kim Jong Il turned it into an enterprise conducive to developing the province's economy and improving the people's living standard.
					
					 The Usi Mine is associated the warm benevolence of the President and Kim Jong Il as they paved a wide avenue for boosting its production while paying deep attention to its management and lives of the miners. 
					
					 Inaugural ceremonies took place at the relevant units.

articles.title: 2014 World Breastfeeding Week Observed
articles.content:
2014 World Breastfeeding Week Observed
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A symposium took place at the Grand People's Study House on Thursday on the occasion of the 2014 World Breastfeeding Week.
					 Present there were officials of the Ministry of Public Health and national institutions including the Grand People's Study House, public health workers in the city and staff members of the missions of UNICEF and WHO here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Speakers said that it is a vital issue decisive of the future destiny of the country and nation to bring up children in good health.
					
					 They underscored the need to steadily raise the social concern and understanding of the importance of breastfeeding to steadily promote the health of children and mothers.
					
					 There were speeches titled "validity and vitality of our country's policy on nursing and upbringing children" and "1 000-day healthcare of children and importance of first breastfeeding."
					
					 The participants watched a video "healthcare for breastfeeding babies".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats for Development of National Music
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats for Development of National Music
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- To create music based on traditional melody is a consistent policy the Workers' Party of Korea has adhered to in building the Juche-oriented musical art.
					 Leader Kim Jong Il advanced this policy and had made all possible efforts for the development of the national music.
					
					 He stressed the need to create popular and refined songs on the basis of traditional melodies to suit the Korean people's sentiments and modern aesthetic sense, as taught by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 In December Juche 79 (1990) he made public a work "On Improving the Musical Creation and Dissemination", underlining that every song should be created in Korean style as famous music of the times perfect in ideological content and artistry. 
					
					 And he, in another work "Theory of Musical Art", gave a clear-cut exposition of such problems for the development of national music as retaining the peculiarities and tune of folksongs and re-depicting those songs.
					
					 Under his meticulous guidance, a lot of music pieces in the style of ballad were created one after another, including songs "Arirang of Prosperity" and "Nilliri for Songun".
					
					 He also paid deep attention to developing the Juche-based symphony on the principle of arranging folk and other popular songs with a combination of traditional and Western musical instruments.
					
					 He guided the work to improve the national musical instruments, too.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's feats for the development of the national music are now being carried forward by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Sohung Primary School, Noted for Creditably Running Taekwon-Do Group
articles.content:
Sohung Primary School, Noted for Creditably Running Taekwon-Do Group
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Sohung Primary School in Moranbong District, Pyongyang is well known for creditably running the Taekwon-Do group.
					 The school took the first place in the Taekwon-Do event for the 40th National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize that came to an end some days ago, thus becoming a third consecutive winner in the event.
					
					 It is 17 years ago that the school began running a Taekwon-Do group after selecting it as a key sporting event.
					
					 The group finished second in a city-wide tournament only one year after its organization, and has bagged 18 gold medals in national tournaments until now.
					
					 The school is now intensifying the Taekwon-Do training to retain its national championship.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns U.S. Not to Be Overconfident to Ruin Itself
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns U.S. Not to Be Overconfident to Ruin Itself
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the U.S. Defense Department recently blustered that the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises would be put on a permanent basis.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this proves that the U.S. never wants peace and stability on the Korean peninsula but sticks to its brigandish scenario to swallow up the whole Korean nation and its territory by force.
					
					 The U.S. strategy toward Korea precisely means a strategy of strength, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S.-led joint military exercises ceaselessly staged on the peninsula for decades are part of its moves to ignite a war against the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S.-south Korea war maneuvers targeting the DPRK are the largest in the world in their scale and number and very dangerous in their programs.
					
					 What the U.S. belligerent forces are seeking is not the DPRK only.
					
					 The U.S. strategists have regarded the Korean peninsula as a "bridge for crossing the continent" for "Americanizing" the world and a "dagger" for cutting off "a large lump of meat" called "Asia" up this date since the Soviet-U.S. Cold War era.
					
					 The north-targeted madcap war maneuvers staged in south Korea and its vicinity in recent years, assuming more provocative and aggressive nature, would be unthinkable without the U.S. pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					 It is the invariable intention of the U.S. to periodically strain the situation on the Korean peninsula and meet its aggressive and hegemonic interests.
					
					 One's overconfidence is bound to lead to one's self-ruin.
					
					 The DPRK, an independent and sovereign state, ranks itself among a few nuclear weapons states.
					
					 The U.S. rulers would be well advised not to disregard the fear of the DPRK's nuclear weapons and missiles growing among the U.S. forces deployed on the peninsula and in its vicinity.

articles.title: Resentment at S. Korean Chief Executive Mounts among Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Resentment at S. Korean Chief Executive Mounts among Koreans in U.S.
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Resentment at the south Korean chief executive is mounting among Koreans in the U.S., according to Jaju Minbo, an internet paper of south Korea, on Sept. 9.
					 After hearing the news that the chief executive is going to tour the U.S. under the pretext of participating in an international meeting, Koreans in the U.S. said they would turn out in protest against her. 
					
					 They urged her to meet with bereaved family members of the ferry Sewol tragedy before touring a foreign country. 
					
					 They declared Koreans in the U.S. would hold rallies and demonstrations demanding the institution of a special law on the ferry Sewol including the right to investigate and indict those responsible for the disaster and denouncing the present regime in New York, Washington, Los Angeles and other parts of the U.S. with the chief executive's visit to the U.S. as a momentum.
					
					 The actions are aimed to support the struggle of people of various circles in south Korea including the bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster, let the world know about the brutality of the present regime, have a special law on the ferry Sewol be instituted at an early date and make the truth about the disaster be probed, they stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservative Group Slammed for Insulting Bereaved Families of Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservative Group Slammed for Insulting Bereaved Families of Ferry Sewol Disaster
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, in an article on September 10 denounced the puppet conservative group for insulting the bereaved families of the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The article accused gentries of the ultra-right conservative organization of south Korea of staging such rowdyism as insulting the bereaved families who were staging a hunger strike in demand of the probe into the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster at the Kwanghwamun plaza in Seoul on September 6.
					
					 The conservative group held a frantic rally and conducted a signature campaign against the institution of a special law on the ferry Sewol while eating food before the bereaved families, the article noted, adding that such hooliganism can be perpetrated only by politically depraved guys. 
					
					 This depraved group deserves a severe punishment, it said, adding it is a bitter lesson taught by history.

articles.title: Actions for Acquittal of Those Involved in Case of Attempted Rebellion Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Acquittal of Those Involved in Case of Attempted Rebellion Staged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- There took place a rally outside the Suwon Prison, Kyonggi Province, south Korea on September 9 demanding the acquittal of those involved in the case of the attempted rebellion.
					 At the rally the participants held the case of the attempted rebellion is not a guilt from a legal point of view from A to Z.
					
					 They declared they would stage positive actions to make sure that the Supreme Court make an acquittal decision in the future.
					
					 They urged the Supreme Court to make a decision of conscience for those arrested including Ri Sok Gi.
					
					 Actions demanding the acquittal of those detained were also staged before the Seoul prison and the Anyang prison.

articles.title: Seminars Held in Different Countries to Mark Birthday of DPRK
articles.content:
Seminars Held in Different Countries to Mark Birthday of DPRK
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Seminars took place in Romania, DR Congo and Guinea on Sept. 3 and 4 on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Present there were personages of various social standings and masses of relevant countries.
					
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Party for the Socialist Choice of Romania, said that President Kim Il Sung liberated Korea from the Japanese imperialists' military occupation and led to victory the bloody struggle against the formidable U.S. imperialists, turning the DPRK into a socialist power with his outstanding leadership.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il protected the dignity and sovereignty of the country, while smashing the imperialists' moves to apply all sorts of sanctions and stifle the DPRK with his Songun revolutionary leadership and developed the DPRK into a full-fledged nuclear weapons state, the chairman stressed.
					
					 Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the DR Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, noted that Korean-style socialism built by Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il has grown stronger under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Camano Vitor, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry, Guinea, referred to the fact that the DPRK, which has advanced straight along the road of Juche for the past 66 years since its foundation, is shedding its rays all over the world as a socialist power.
					
					 Abdoulaye Diallo, chairman of the Guinean Society for the Study of the Juche Literary Idea, said that the course covered by the DPRK is the one in which it has advanced and won victory by dint of Songun, praising the undying exploits Kim Il Sung performed by building the country and the  Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Nigerian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Nigerian Organization
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted articles on its website on August 27 and 30 on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 An article titled "Founder of the DPRK" said:
					
					 Kim Il Sung whom the Korean people hold as eternal President is the founder of the DPRK.
					
					 He wisely led the country and its people as head of state of the DPRK for a long period.
					
					 Under his leadership the less than two-year old DPRK beat back the aggression by the U.S., which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world, in the Korean war, protecting the sovereignty and dignity of the country. It wound up the postwar rehabilitation and construction in a short span of time and successfully carried out the socialist revolution and construction.
					
					 We pay high tribute to Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK which has demonstrated its might as an invincible power.

articles.title: Foreigners Praise Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Praise Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Various events took place in foreign countries on the occasion of the 66th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 They included a celebration meeting, friendly meeting, book and photo exhibition and film shows in Norway, Austria, Iran and Thailand on Sept. 2 and 4.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos showing the feats of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, books and photos introducing socialist Korea.
					
					 Films shown included Korean film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 The chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway said the feats Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by founding and developing the DPRK would shine forever together with the bright future of socialist Korea.
					
					 The president of the International Taekwon-Do Association in Iran noted the DPRK, which was founded by Kim Il Sung and developed by Kim Jong Il, was demonstrating the dignity and might to the world thanks to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association praised Kim Il Sung for freeing the Korean people from the colonial slavery enforced by the Japanese imperialists and founding the DPRK. Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into an invulnerable socialist fortress, the chairman added.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events in Norway, Austria and Thailand.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante el feretro de difunto Kim Nam O
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante el feretro de difunto Kim Nam O
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 11 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kim Nam O, condecorado con la Orden Kim Il Sung, quien es ex director del Conjunto de Musica Electronica Pochonbo, en senal de profundas condolencias por su deceso.

articles.title: Nota de entendimiento entre RPDC y Mongolia
articles.content:
Nota de entendimiento entre RPDC y Mongolia
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo firmada el dia 11 en esta capital la nota de entendimiento sobre la cooperacion cientifica y tecnica entre el Comite Estatal de Ciencias y Tecnicas de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y el Ministerio de Educacion y Ciencia de Mongolia. 
					Participaron por la parte coreana el vicepresidente Jon Kyong y otros funcionarios del Comite Estatal de Ciencias y Tecnicas, y por la mongola, el embajador Manibadrakh Ganbold y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica acreditada en Corea.

articles.title: ACR de RPDC traslada a morador surcoreano a la SCR del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ACR de RPDC traslada a morador surcoreano a la SCR del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea traslado el dia 11 por via Phanmunjom a la Sociedad de la Cruz Roja del Sur de Corea a un morador surcoreano que entro ilegalmente en la parte Norte.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam se reune con primer vicepresidente de Consejo de Federacion de Rusia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam se reune con primer vicepresidente de Consejo de Federacion de Rusia
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, departio el dia 11 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el primer vicepresidente del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia, Alexandr Torshyn. 
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente de la APS, An Tong Chun, y el embajador Alexandr Timonin y un miembro de la sede diplomatica rusa en Corea.
					
					En la ocasion Alexandr Torshyn expreso agradecimiento por las hospitalidades cordiales del pueblo coreano y expuso la decision de hacer ingentes esfuerzos por desarrollar las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Kang Sok Ju y Niels Annen
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Kang Sok Ju y Niels Annen
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 8 las conversaciones entre el miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kang Sok Ju, quien preside la delegacion del PTC de visita en la Republica Federal de Alemania, y el presidente del Comite Internacional del Partido Social-Democrata de Alemania, Niels Annen.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion arriba mencionada y el embajador en Alemania, y por la alemana, el coordinador de politica exterior del Grupo del Partido Social-Democrata de Bundestag (Parlamento Federal) y el director de la Sede de la Fundacion "Friedrich Ebert" del mismo partido.
					
					En la ocasion se discutieron los temas de ampliar y desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos.
					
					El mismo dia, la delegacion del PTC fue invitada al banquete ofrecido por Niels Annen.
					
					Por otra parte, Kang Sok Ju departio con el delegado del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y otros funcionarios del pais europeo.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong felicita a Rafael Ramirez Carreno
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong felicita a Rafael Ramirez Carreno
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, envio el dia 10 un mensaje de felicitacion a Rafael Ramirez Carreno, recien nombrado como vicepremier y ministro de Relaciones Exteriores del poder popular de la Republica Bolivariana de Venezuela. 
					El remitente expresa la esperanza y conviccion de que este ano significativo del 40o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre los dos paises, las relaciones bilaterales se ampliaran y se desarrollaran en una etapa mas alta y desea al destinatario exitos en el cumplimiento de su nuevo cargo.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju averigua Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju averigua Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno el Complejo Termoelectrico de Pyongyang.
					Recorriendo los talleres de produccion de calor y de turbina y otros lugares, estimulo a los obreros e hizo detallado conocimiento de la produccion y de la administracion de las instalaciones.
					
					La reunion consultiva de los funcionarios, convocada en el terreno, busco las medidas para poner en pleno funcionamiento las turbinas al organizar con escrupulosidad la administracion de instalaciones y tecnica, suministrar satisfactoriamente los materiales necesarios a la reparacion de los equipos generadores y elevar la eficacia de generacion de electricidad.
					
					Subrayo que todos los funcionarios y los obreros de la empresa deben movilizarse como un solo hombre a la produccion de la electricidad teniendo presente que el aumento de la produccion electrica de hoy es la labor para materializar y defender la idea y la politica del partido.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier recorrio la Mina Carbonifera Juventud 8 de Febrero de Jikdong.
					
					Pak subrayo la importancia del deber que asume la mina en la solucion del problema de la electricidad y discutio los remedios para aumentar la produccion de carbon. 
					
					Por otra parte, Pak Pong Ju estudio las labores del Instituto Central de Mineria de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, ocasion en la cual se refirio a que los cientificos y tecnicos deben garantizar con firmeza con los exitos cientificos y tecnicos la construccion de potencia economica.
